decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to aggressively use the instant and sorcery spells in combination with Vial Smasher the Fierce's ability to deal damage to opponents. The deck includes a wide range of low-cost spells for disruption and removal, along with some powerful threats like Delver of Secrets and Goblin Dark-Dwellers. The deck aims to control the game early on with counterspells and removal, while also applying pressure with its creatures and burn spells. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three colors effectively, allowing for consistent casting of the spells. Overall, the strategy revolves around combining aggression and control to quickly defeat the opponent in a 1 vs 1 duel.

This deck revolves around utilizing Vial Smasher the Fierce as the commander in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format to aggressively control the game. The deck includes a wide array of spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy, including counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command, removal spells like Terminate and Murderous Cut, and hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also features versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and True-Name Nemesis to provide additional threats on the battlefield. By combining efficient removal, counterspells, and hand disruption with a proactive commander like Vial Smasher, this deck aims to control the game while dealing consistent damage to the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells and bouncing their creatures back to their hand. Baral, Chief of Compliance helps reduce the cost of instants and sorceries, allowing for more efficient spellcasting. The deck also includes a variety of card draw spells to ensure a steady stream of resources. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for a big finish with powerful spells like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Blue Sun's Zenith. The mana base is built to support a high count of Islands to take advantage of Baral's ability, while also including utility lands like Wasteland and Mishra's Factory for additional control options.

The main focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent through aggressive plays and efficient creature recursion. With Reyhan, Last of the Abzan as the commander, the deck aims to utilize powerful creatures like Bloodbraid Elf, Tarmogoyf, and Siege Rhino to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes cards like Survival of the Fittest and Fauna Shaman to ensure a steady stream of threats on the board. Additionally, the deck has removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminate to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a creature-based strategy while maintaining card advantage and flexibility through recursion and removal options.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and bouncing their threats back to their hand. With Baral, Chief of Compliance as the commander, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw to maintain control of the game. It also features powerful cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to close out the game. By leveraging the commander's ability to reduce the cost of instant and sorcery spells, the deck can efficiently answer threats and eventually overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to deploy efficient and aggressive creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent in a one-on-one Duel Commander game. The deck is centered around Akiri, Line-Slinger, using her abilities to boost the power of equipped artifacts and creatures on the battlefield. With a mix of low-cost artifacts and creatures, the deck aims to establish an early board presence and apply constant pressure on the opponent. This aggro strategy is supported by burn spells, removal, and equipment to push through damage and control the battlefield. By utilizing Akiri's abilities and leveraging the artifacts and creatures in the deck effectively, the goal is to rapidly reduce the opponent's life total and secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive tactics with the goal of quickly overwhelming the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and burn spells. Akiri, Line-Slinger serves as the commander and can benefit from the artifacts in the deck. The deck includes a mix of versatile removal spells, artifact creatures that can quickly build up a board presence, and equipment to boost their effectiveness. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors for spells and artifacts. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and continue to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, bounce spells, and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Geist of Saint Traft serves as the commander, providing a strong threat while also being difficult to deal with due to its hexproof ability. The deck includes a variety of permission spells like Counterspell, Mana Leak, and Force of Will to counter key spells from the opponent. It also includes bounce spells like Chain of Vapor and Boomerang to deal with threats on the battlefield. The deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can establish a winning board state through Geist of Saint Traft or other powerful creatures.
